Key Match Events: Weston Wilson drove in the tiebreaking run with an infield single down the third-base line.
Nick Castellanos homered and Zack Wheeler struck out nine batters over six innings.
Wilson’s hit came with two outs in the sixth and allowed Castellanos to score from third.
Nick Castellanos hit a two-run home run off Tampa Bay Rays’ Shane Baz during the first inning.
Jonathan Aranda hit a solo home run off Philadelphia Phillies’ Zack Wheeler during the sixth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Kyle Schwarber was scratched from the lineup after feeling discomfort in his left elbow during batting practice.
Schwarber was removed from the game on Tuesday after hyperextending the elbow while diving into first base on a pickoff attempt.
Post-Match Reflections: Weston Wilson commented on the hit, saying, 'I think they were trying to say that it hit me, but I did not feel a thing.'
Nick Castellanos expressed respect for Tampa Bay manager Kevin Cash for apologizing for the intentional hit by a pitch incident.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies reduced their magic number to clinch their first National League East title since 2011 to nine.
Several injured regulars were out of the lineup, and the Phillies got game-winning hits from Kody Clemens and Cal Stevenson in the first two games of the series.
Buddy Kennedy had a key walk to set up Clemens’ game-winning hit on Monday and an RBI hit replacing Schwarber on Tuesday.
Aramis Garcia made three key defensive plays in place of injured catcher J.T. Realmuto.
